intro: Geonoma deversa subsp. deversa, commonly known as the slender fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pinnate fronds that are often covered in fine hairs. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. The fronds are typically elongated and may vary in color depending on light exposure. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in controlled indoor settings.
